section.title: Main Menu
section.p: The main menu provides the following selection of items:

dl.dd: Activates the task dialog, allowing tasks to be edited, saved and loaded, and for browsing waypoints by name.
Activates the bugs/ballast dialog, allowing entry of bugs and ballast percentages.
Activates the pressure dialog, allowing entry of QNH pressure.

Turns on or off the IGC flight logger. When the logger is started, the current task is written as a declaration at the start of the logger file. A new logger file is created each time the logger is started. The logger files are written using a subset of the IGC format although the logger is not approved for verification of any IGC badge or records.
Provides several pages of configuration settings. Typically these settings are seldom changed after initial installation, and it is recommended they not be modified in flight.
Aborts or resumes the current task.
Activates the Status dialog, giving a quick overview of system status.
Activates the Analysis dialog, giving detailed analysis and statistics on relating to task performance.
Quit the application. Always use this method of closing the application as it ensures that the software is terminated cleanly.
This checkbox allows infoboxes to be edited.
